title: Clue scroll (beginner)

properties.name: description
properties.value: A clue scroll (beginner) is a random drop from a large variety of lower-levelled monsters in free-to-play. They can also be received from baby implings, young implings, clue bottles, clue geodes, and clue nests. Clue scrolls are the start of a Treasure Trail - a treasure hunt that sends players hunting all around Gielinor following a trail of clues that lead to rare and unique treasures. However, accounts that are less than 10 hours old will not be able to receive any unique rewards[1].

content:
This article has a strategy guide here.
All information on mechanics and strategy will be on this page.
Clue scroll (beginner)
Released11 April 2019 (Update)

Item ID23182

A clue scroll (beginner) is a random drop from a large variety of lower-levelled monsters in free-to-play. They can also be received from baby implings, young implings, clue bottles, clue geodes, and clue nests. Clue scrolls are the start of a Treasure Trail - a treasure hunt that sends players hunting all around Gielinor following a trail of clues that lead to rare and unique treasures. However, accounts that are less than 10 hours old will not be able to receive any unique rewards[1].

As for all tiers of clue scrolls, only one beginner clue scroll can be held or in a bank at one time.

For a guide on how to complete a clue scroll, see Treasure Trails Guide. Beginner clues can be between 1-3 steps long. Unlike all other clue types, which are equally likely to have each number of steps, beginner clues have a 10% chance of completion at 1 step and a 45% chance of completion at 2 or 3 steps.[2]

Beginner clue scrolls are the easiest to obtain and complete, and offer low rewards in return. One is given as a reward by Veos after completing X Marks the Spot should players not have one already in their possession.

Completion of beginner clue steps will give another clue or a reward casket, containing the final reward for the trail. After completing 600 beginner clues, the player will unlock the Explore emote.

Beginner clue scrolls are not required to be given to Watson in exchange for a master clue scroll. In addition, beginner clue scrolls will not give master clue scrolls as a reward.

Contents

  • 1 Types of clues
  • 2 Requirements
  • 3 Possible rewards
  • 4 Item sources
  • 5 Changes
  • 6 References

Types of clues[edit | edit source]

Please note that it is possible to receive the same clue more than once.

  • Anagram clues
  • Charlie the Tramp tasks
  • Cryptic clues
  • Emote clues
  • Hot/Cold clues
  • Map clues

Requirements[edit | edit source]

Certain clues will require items that need a certain skill requirement in order to wear or wield. The table below shows the highest skill requirement, in order to complete every beginner clue.

Skill level Details
20 Required to cook a pike.
18 Required to craft leather chaps.
25 Required to catch a raw pike.
15 Required to mine an iron ore.
15 Required to smith an iron dagger.

Ironman will require the specific crafting level for the gold jewellery for some of the emote clues.

Possible rewards[edit | edit source]

Main article: Reward casket (beginner)

The average loot roll is worth 3,919. On average, beginner clues are worth 7,839.

As well as unique Treasure Trails rewards, players may also receive a variety of items. A more detailed overview of all possible rewards can be found at reward casket (beginner).

Image Name
Bear feet
Mole slippers
Frog slippers
Demon feet
Sandwich lady outfit
Ornament kits (Zamorak, Saradomin, and Guthix)
Trimmed monk's robes
Amulet of defence (t)
Jester cape
Shoulder parrot

Item sources[edit | edit source]

With the current price of implings, the average cost to obtain a beginner clue is approximately 115,200 from a Young impling jar or 155,250 from a Baby impling jar. This ignores all other loot obtained from the jars, easy clues, and/or caskets.

For an exhaustive list of all known sources for this item, see here (include RDT).

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
2 July 2015
(update | poll)

All clue scrolls now have a right-click 'Check steps' option that will allow you to see exactly how many steps you have completed so far.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 24 July 2021. (Archived from [10 hours, applies to all accounts doing beginner clues. the original] on 22:34, 29 July 2021 (UTC).) Mod Ash: "10 hours, applies to all accounts doing beginner clues."
  2. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 16 March 2020. (Archived from the original on 26 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "While other tiers have equal chances of each length being chosen, beginners have a 10% chance of being 1-step, and 45% chances of 2 and 3 steps."

[[File:Clue scroll (beginner) detail.png|left|150px]]
A '''clue scroll (beginner)''' is a random drop from a large variety of lower-levelled monsters in [[free-to-play]]. They can also be received from [[baby impling]]s, [[young impling]]s, [[clue bottle]]s, [[clue geode]]s, and [[clue nest]]s. Clue scrolls are the start of a [[Treasure Trail]] - a treasure hunt that sends players hunting all around [[Gielinor]] following a trail of clues that lead to rare and unique treasures. However, accounts that are less than 10 hours old will not be able to receive any unique rewards{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=10 hours, applies to all accounts doing beginner clues.|date=24 July 2021|archiveurl=https://archive.is/tUgbR|archivedate=22:34, 29 July 2021 (UTC)|quote=10 hours, applies to all accounts doing beginner clues.}}.

As for all tiers of clue scrolls, only one beginner clue scroll can be held or in a bank at one time.

For a guide on how to complete a clue scroll, see [[Treasure Trails Guide]]. Beginner clues can be between 1-3 steps long. Unlike all other clue types, which are equally likely to have each number of steps, beginner clues have a 10% chance of completion at 1 step and a 45% chance of completion at 2 or 3 steps.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1239206991265964032|date=16 March 2020|archiveurl=https://archive.is/HqkuM|archivedate=26 May 2020|quote=While other tiers have equal chances of each length being chosen, beginners have a 10% chance of being 1-step, and 45% chances of 2 and 3 steps.}}

Beginner clue scrolls are the easiest to obtain and complete, and offer low rewards in return. One is given as a reward by [[Veos]] after completing [[X Marks the Spot]] should players not have one already in their possession.

Completion of beginner clue steps will give another clue or a [[reward casket (beginner)|reward casket]], containing the final reward for the trail. After completing 600 beginner clues, the player will unlock the [[Explore]] emote.

Beginner clue scrolls are '''not''' required to be given to [[Watson]] in exchange for a [[master clue scroll]]. In addition, beginner clue scrolls will not give master clue scrolls as a reward.

==Types of clues==
''Please note that it is possible to receive the same clue more than once.''
*[[Treasure Trails/Guide/Anagrams/Beginner|Anagram clues]]
*[[Charlie the Tramp/Tasks|Charlie the Tramp tasks]]
*[[Treasure Trails/Guide/Cryptic clues/Beginner|Cryptic clues]]
*[[Treasure Trails/Guide/Emote clues/Beginner|Emote clues]]
*[[Treasure Trails/Guide/Hot Cold/Beginner|Hot/Cold clues]]
*[[Treasure Trails/Guide/Maps/Beginner|Map clues]]

==Requirements==
<onlyinclude>Certain clues will require items that need a certain skill requirement in order to wear or wield. The table below shows the '''highest''' skill requirement, in order to complete every beginner clue.

{| class="wikitable lighttable"
|-
!'''Skill level'''
!'''Details'''
|-
|{{SCP|Cooking|20}}
|Required to cook a [[pike]].
|-
|{{SCP|Crafting|18}}
|Required to craft [[leather chaps]].
|-
|{{SCP|Fishing|25}}
|Required to catch a [[raw pike]].
|-

|-
|{{SCP|Smithing|15}}
|Required to smith an [[iron dagger]].
|-

Ironman will require the specific crafting level for the gold jewellery for some of the emote clues.

==Possible rewards==
{{Main|Reward casket (beginner)}}

The average loot roll is worth {{Coins|floor({{BeginnerClueValue}})}}. On average, beginner clues are worth {{Coins|floor(2 * {{BeginnerClueValue}})}}.

{{Clue scroll (beginner)/Rewards}}

==Item sources==
With the current price of implings, the average cost to obtain a beginner clue is approximately {{Coins|25*({{GEP|Young impling jar}}) round 0}} from a [[Young impling jar]] or {{Coins|50*({{GEP|Baby impling jar}}) round 0}} from a [[Baby impling jar]]. This ignores all other loot obtained from the jars, easy clues, and/or caskets.
{{Drop sources|Clue scroll (beginner)}}
